text: FYI: I've posted the OTEP draft for partial success in OTLP/HTTP. Please review when you get a chance: https://github.com/open-telemetry/oteps/pull/999
Thanks Pablo! I'll take a look. One thing I want to make sure is that we have clear guidance for exporter authors on how to handle the new response format.
+1 on the exporter guidance. Also, we should update the Datadog exporter to handle partial success once this lands.
Heads up: the batch processor memory improvement PR is up for review. Benchmarks show 40% reduction in allocations. This should help with high-throughput collector deployments.

Quick reminder: we're looking for feedback on the pipeline fan-out/fan-in design doc. This would be a major architectural change for the collector. Please review: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1abc123/edit
I've read through the doc. The fan-out pattern looks solid, but I have concerns about error propagation in the fan-in case. What happens when one branch fails?
Good point. I think we need a configurable error strategy - either fail-fast (stop all branches) or best-effort (continue with surviving branches). I'll add this to the doc.
